page.title: 05POPULATION INCREASES
page.content: From the time of the{Domesday Book until the beginning of the twentieth century the population of Thurnscoe has remained approximately the same. Records show that there were only{217 people in Thurnscoe up until the time of the opening of Hickleton Main Colliery. After the opening of the pit the population increased dramatically by over a thousand. It continued to increase because of the coal industry for many years. The{Census of 1981}showed the most recent population count this total was{11,445.}These figures also show that the population has{declined between 1971 and 1981 by{11%} This can be accounted for by the reduction in coalmining since 1977 at Hickleton. Also by reduction in employment at connected industries in the area.
